item.title: How "Silicon Valley" Nails Silicon Valley - The New Yorker
item.description:
How "Silicon Valley" Nails Silicon Valley - The New Yorker

When Dick Costolo attended the University of Michigan, in the nineteen-eighties, his major was computer science, but he was surprised to find that he also had a knack for improv comedy. After graduation, he moved to Chicago and took classes at the Second City Theatre.

item.title: Entrepreneur on the Island: A Conversation with Paul Jarvis
item.description:
Entrepreneur on the Island: A Conversation with Paul Jarvis

Despite living deep in the woods on a remote island, Paul Jarvis is relentlessly productive. During his 17-year career as a freelance entrepreneur, Paul has launched a diverse portfolio of products and businesses that spans online courses, software products, a respected body of writing, and two podcasts.

item.title: What are co-branded credit cards?
item.description:
What are co-branded credit cards?

Costco made headlines when it announced its split from American Express and its new relationship with Citi and Visa, which launches in June. It's a big deal, mostly because the warehouse giant has had an exclusive relationship with AmEx for more than 16 years, offering its more than 80 million shoppers co-branded credit cards that can be used anywhere and earn special rewards for Costco purchases.
